results.title: Gurrawilla
results.creator_credit: Chelsea Studios for the Education Department of Victoria, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Alan Marshall: author and man”.
At one time, Marshall lived with the Aborigines in Arnhem Land, and he tells us how he became known as ‘Gurrawilla’. He also describes in a light-hearted manner tales of his childhood.

results.title: Gurdeep Singh Bains
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Yuki Yoshida, Kathleen Shannon and Beverly Shaffer
results.brief_description: Gurdeep is a thirteen-year-old Canadian Sikh whose family runs a dairy farm in the southern coastal plain of British Columbia. They have retained their language and religion. Attendance at the Sikh temple, playing soccer with his schoolmates and working on the farm are all part of Gurdeep’s life but sometimes he feels different from other children, because he wears a turban.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Yuki Yoshida, Kathleen Shannon and Beverly Shaffer

results.title: Guppies in biological control of mosquitoes
results.brief_description: Shows how the combined use of biological and chemical measures enabled Japanese scientists to exterminate noxious creatures without exterminating the environment. Biological control of mosquito larvae is contrasted to chemical methods, indicating that guppies are more effective than pesticides.

results.title: Guns for life
results.creator_credit: Alberta Native Communications Society, ONF | NFB and Jeff Howard
results.brief_description: As we follow the Native Americans on a hunting trip, the film explores how gun laws are designed to prevent people who may be criminals or irresponsible, from owning a gun. Also covered are safety regulations for those who do have a certificate to won a gun, and the consequences if these are ignored.

results.title: Guns and roses
results.creator_credit: Open Channel Productions, John Moore, Helen Bowman and Carole Sklan
results.brief_description: After enduring years of constant physical and psychological abuse, Melody shot and killed her husband. This film examines the criminal justice system and the conspiracy of silence surrounding domestic violence, through interviews with Melody, her sister, her lawyer, a psychologist specialising in the effects of domestic violence and the supreme court judge who heard her case. Included is an interview with Phil Cleary, M.P. for Wills whose sister was killed by her partner.

results.title: Gumby : funday

results.title: Gum
results.brief_description: A playful cut-out animation of a man and woman blowing bubbles of gum whilst dancing to music against the starry night and city lights. Their romantic interlude is interrupted when an alien bursts their bubble. Done as a collaboration by Jasmin de Wolf and de Ville.
